result.name: ni_122_-_mortality_from_all_cancers_at_ages_under_75
result.notes:
Directly age standardised mortality rates per 100,000 population for cancer (all malignant neoplasms) at all ages under 75 years

Source: Department of Health (DoH)

Publisher: DCLG Floor Targets Interactive

Geographies: Local Authority District (LAD), County/Unitary Authority, Government Office Region (GOR), National

Geographic coverage: England

Time coverage: 1996/08 to 2006/08 (three year rolling averages)

Type of data: Administrative data (age standardised)

Notes: Mortality rates are age standardised using the European Standard Population as defined by the World Health Organisation.

odi-certificate.title: NI 122 - Mortality from all cancers at ages under 75

organization.name: department-of-health
organization.title: Department of Health and Social Care
organization.description:
The Department of Health and Social Care (DHSC) helps people to live better for longer. We lead, shape and fund health and social care in England, making sure people have the support, care and treatment they need, with the compassion, respect and dignity they deserve.

DHSC is a ministerial department, supported by 27 agencies and public bodies. 

https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-of-health-and-social-care

result.precision: Numbers of deaths for 2000 and previous years to 1998 are based on ICD-9 coded data adjusted to ICD-10.  For circulatory disease and cancer recoding means that the data comprising the 1999-01 and 2000-02 averages are not strictly comparable and should be treated with caution.
result.title: NI 122 - Mortality from all cancers at ages under 75
